description: Instead of raging, you can choose to Frenzy, which allows you to make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one for the duation of rage. When rage ends, you gain one level of exhaustion.
Beginning at 6th level, you can't be charmed or frightened while raging. If you are charmed or frightened when you enter your rage, the effect is suspended for the duration of the rage.
Starting at 2nd level, you can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly.
At 2nd level, you gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see
You gain the ability to cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells, but only as rituals.
At 3rd level, when you adopt this path, you choose a totem spirit and gain its feature. Options include Bear, Eagle, and Wolf.
At 6th level, you gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice. Options include Bear, Eagle, and Wolf.
At 10th level, you can cast the Commune with Nature spell, but only as a ritual.
At 14th level, you gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice. Options include Bear, Eagle, and Wolf.

Description: At 1st level, you choose a divine domain that grants you domain spells and other features.
At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects.
Starting at 5th level, when an undead fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed if its CR is at or below a certain threshold.
Beginning at 10th level, you can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf when your need is great.
Each domain has a list of spells—its domain spells—that you gain at the cleric levels noted in the domain description.
At 1st level, you learn two languages of your choice and become proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion.

FeatureName: Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages
Description: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to tap into a divine well of knowledge.
At 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to read a creature's thoughts.
Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.
Starting at 17th level, you can call up visions of the past that relate to an object you hold or your immediate surroundings.
